text: If you think about a Thanksgiving dinner, it's really like making a large chicken.
author: Ina Garten

text: I absolutely adore Thanksgiving. It's the only holiday I insist on making myself.
author: Ina Garten

text: A lot of Thanksgiving days have been ruined by not carving the turkey in the kitchen.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: As much as I love crisp, clean whites, there's always a time for rich but balanced Chardonnays with oak, especially at Thanksgiving.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: Not to sound too much like Christopher Guest in 'Waiting for Guffman,' but on Thanksgiving you're putting on a show!
author: Ted Allen

text: I've spent a lot of Thanksgivings on the road with my band, so anytime that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family in a traditional aspect, eating sweet potatoes and cranberries and stuffing and all the trappings of Thanksgiving and then get on a treadmill the next day extra long, I'm happy.
author: Richie Sambora

text: My favorite meal is turkey and mashed potatoes. I love Thanksgiving, it's just my favorite. I can have Thanksgiving all year round.
author: Cindy Margolis

text: I never drank except a couple sips of wine at Thanksgiving.
author: Carol Alt

text: Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling. Thanksgiving is the following of that impulse.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: If you think Independence Day is America's defining holiday, think again. Thanksgiving deserves that title, hands-down.
author: Tony Snow

text: Thanksgiving is nothing but a toast to genocide.
author: Stephen Evans

text: The craft Emmys are kind of the kids' table at Thanksgiving. You're not really invited to the big dance. It's still really, really exciting, and the statue still counts.
author: Hank Azaria

text: In our family, mom and dad are Longhorns, our first two kids are Aggies and we're hoping our last one is a Longhorn. It gives us family fun on Thanksgiving Day.
author: Bob Wells

text: I think I'm going to give my baby her first food on Thanksgiving, make her some organic sweet potato. I'm very excited! It's going to be a big day and my husband is in charge of the turkey - he's the chef of the family!
author: Lily Aldridge

text: Thanksgiving is a season that is very much in accord with the themes and teachings of Jesus Christ.
author: John Clayton

text: My whole problem is that all of my favorite things at Thanksgiving are the starches, and everyone is trying to go low-carb this year, even a green vegetable has carbs in it.
author: Ted Allen

text: Thanksgiving dinners take eighteen hours to prepare. They are consumed in twelve minutes. Half-times take twelve minutes. This is not coincidence.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: Over the Thanksgiving holiday I took time to reflect on what is most important to me and realized I need to find a way to put the fun back into racing.
author: Kurt Busch

text: There is one day that is ours. Thanksgiving Day is the one day that is purely American.
author: O. Henry

text: I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land.
author: Jon Stewart

text: It's so warm now, and Thanksgiving came so early - is it just me, or does it not really feel like Ramadan?
author: David Letterman

text: Pride slays thanksgiving, but a humble mind is the soil out of which thanks naturally grow. A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: As governor, when I visited our troops in Kuwait and Iraq, I served them Thanksgiving dinner. It was a small gesture compared to their sacrifice.
author: Jennifer M. Granholm

text: My cooking is so bad my kids thought Thanksgiving was to commemorate Pearl Harbor.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: I have nothing against turkey. We eat turkey for Thanksgiving in my house.
author: Marc Forgione

text: To give thanks in solitude is enough. Thanksgiving has wings and goes where it must go. Your prayer knows much more about it than you do.
author: Victor Hugo
